title: Reported for picking the "wrong" champ
body:
So was playing ranked silver and was told to go top (I was last pick as usual).  Normally i sup/mid or jungle.  So i picked a champ that was off the meta and the rest of my team said they reported me.  

They told me who they preferred I  play  I said that I was unfamiliar with those champs and would probably end up feeding (in which case they would report me anyways probably).

Can I be reported and banned for picking off meta champs for roles  even If you're half decent with them?

replies.body:
You're not going to get punished for playing something off meta in the current system. 

That said there's a lot to be said for communication, like asking your team if they mind if you try something a little different? I've had a lot of success with that method, for a while I was convinced that LeBlanc support could be a thing and I just asked my team if they were OK with it and went from there.

Picking off meta is fine , you should never accept anyone telling you what you can and cant pick , and you certainly shouldnt be reported for it , but you should still be attempting to pick someone that , A: compliments and fits with the other picks on your team as a whole , and B: that matches up against what your lane opponent is. Ranked isnt the place for trying random things out though , you should do that in normal games where there is less pressure , you should really be picking things that your experienced using .If you dont have enough depth in champions your comfortable with to cover all roles , maybe you should consider finding one to cover that gap and practice with it. Just out of curiosity , what did you pick?
